metadata.role: Senior Staff Product Manager, API & Developer Experience
metadata.jobDescription:
Senior Staff Product Manager - API & Developer Experience

Location: San Francisco
Salary Range: $226,800–$400,000 per year (Zone 1)

Company Overview:
Plaid is a fintech infrastructure company founded in 2013, headquartered in San Francisco.
The company connects millions of people to financial applications by enabling secure
connections to 12,000+ financial institutions across the US, Canada, UK, and Europe.

Team & Role:
The Developer Experience (DevX) team empowers developers building next-generation
financial services. This leadership position focuses on "how developers first encounter,
understand and integrate with Plaid," spanning APIs, documentation, SDKs, sandbox
environments, and integration tooling.

Key Responsibilities:
- Define vision and strategy for developer experience across onboarding, documentation,
  SDKs, error handling, tooling, sandbox, and support flows
- Engage directly with developers through research and collaboration with Developer Relations
- Partner with Engineering and Design to ship intuitive experiences reducing time-to-integration
- Champion consistent, high-quality developer experience standards
- Balance qualitative feedback with quantitative metrics (activation rates, NPS, adoption)

Required Qualifications:
- 8+ years product management experience in developer platforms, APIs, or infrastructure
- Deep technical fluency with APIs, SDKs, and documentation
- Demonstrated passion for reducing friction in developer tooling
- Strong communication skills for both technical and executive audiences
- Hands-on development experience

Nice-to-Have Skills:
- Fintech, infrastructure, or API-first company background
- Familiarity with OpenAPI/Swagger, Postman, GitHub, or API client tools

hero.subheadline: API & Developer Experience PM with 8+ years shipping SDKs, APIs, and developer tools. From Flow CLI to Ankr's Advanced API serving 1M+ daily requests—I make complex infrastructure feel simple.

about.tagline: Eight years building developer platforms where technical depth meets developer empathy—from blockchain SDKs to API architectures powering millions of requests.
bio:
At Dapper Labs, I owned Developer Experience—shipping the Flow CLI and Cadence Playground redesign that reduced time-to-first-deploy by 60%. At Ankr, I built the Advanced API from 0→1 (17 methods across NFT, Token, Query APIs) serving 1M+ daily requests, plus the SDK suite (Ankr.js, Ankr.py, React Hooks) with 1,900+ weekly downloads. At Forte, I productized Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs for AAA gaming studios. I've spent years obsessing over API ergonomics, documentation clarity, and what makes developer onboarding feel effortless.
Plaid's mission resonates deeply—I've lived the pain of fragmented financial data integration and understand how critical {{accent}}great developer experience{{/accent}} is for platform adoption. My fintech experience at Anchorage Digital (institutional custody APIs, ETF-grade infrastructure) combined with hands-on API/SDK building makes this role feel like a natural fit. I'm excited about defining the vision for how developers experience Plaid.

caseStudies.reasoning: Direct developer tools experience—CLI and playground redesign with 60% onboarding improvement. Perfect match for DevEx leadership.
Built Advanced API (0→1), SDK suite serving 1M+ daily requests. API design, documentation, developer platform at scale.
SDK architecture for external developers. API ergonomics and developer empathy in practice.
API integration patterns, cross-functional coordination, framework development.
API design at enterprise scale, documentation for complex systems.
